abc is correct

abc correct

For(ID thisloop: Map.keyset()) is correct

Selected Answer: B
B is correct. To schedule a class you need to implement Schedulable interface. But in A answer there is a syntax error: shoud be Database.Batchable<sObject>

comments.content: A is incorrect. If you try declare class in this way you`ll get the error: No type arguments provided for a parameterized type: Database.Batchable. If declaration was global inherited sharing class ProcessAccountProcessor implements Database.Batchable<sObject>, Schedulable then A would be correct answer

discussion.content: Why not A here? If this is for a large number, batchable might be of interest as well

questions.question_text:
A developer has a requirement to write Apex code to update a large number of account records on a nightly basis. The system administrator needs to be able to schedule the class to run after business hours on an as-needed basis.

Which class definition should be used to successfully implement this requirement?

choices.A: global inherited sharing class ProcessAccountProcessor implements Database.Batchable, Schedulable
choices.B: global inherited sharing class ProcessAccountProcessor implements Schedulable
choices.C: global inherited sharing class ProcessAccountProcesscr implements Database.Batchable
choices.D: global inherited sharing class ProcessAccountProcessor implements Queueable

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
When we create M-D field we can see this onformation:
Master-Detail Relationship: Creates a special type of parent-child relationship between this object (the child, or "detail") and another object (the parent, or "master") where....

Why would be the D? 

Standard Objects can't be on the detail side, either the question is wrong or the answers are wrong.

Selected Answer: D
I think the correct wording is from "child" to "master"...
So, being that in this case we need Engineering_Support__c to be the child and Opportunity to be the master, in order to have one Opp related to many ES's and one ES to only one Opp.
In order to setup this relationship you have to navigate to the ES object and do the setup there, you always to the setup in the object that will be on the detail side (child).
Also, in order to setup a rollup summary field on the Opp that aggregates data from the ESs it's a requierment that Opp is the master and ES the child, to see it available.

comments.content: Your Point is correct that Opportunity should be the parent, but option D is correct as We have to create M-D Relation from Engineering_Support__c to Opportunity

discussion.content: Option A is the correct choice because when a Master-detail field is created from the parent Opportunity object to the child Engineering_Support__c object, it enforces a one-to-many relationship where each Engineering_Support__c record can be associated with only one Opportunity record. This ensures that each Engineering_Support__c record is related to a specific Opportunity record, and multiple Engineering_Support__c records can be associated with a single Opportunity record.
if it's going to be shown in the Opportunity then the field is a roll-up summary on the master. isn't the supposed to be letter A?
I thought standard object cannot be detailed of the master details relationship

comments.content: Only User and Lead Object do not support this type of relationship, the rest yes!

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers has a support process that allows users to request support from its engineering team using a custom object, Engineering_Support__c.

Users should be able to associate multiple Engineering_Support__c records to a single Opportunity record. Additionally, aggregate information about the Engineering_Support__c records should be shown on the Opportunity record.

What should a developer implement to support these requirements?

choices.D: Master-detail field from Engineering_Support__c to Opportunity
choices.B: Lookup field from Engineering_Support__c to Opportunity
choices.A: Master-detail field from Opportunity to Engineering_Support__c
choices.C: Lookup field from Opportunity to Engineering_Support__c

questions.question_text:
AW Computing tracks order information in custom objects called Order__c and Order_Line__c. Currently, all shipping information is stored in the Order__c object.

The company wants to expand its order application to support split shipments so that any number of Order_Line__c records on a single Order__c can be shipped to different locations.

What should a developer add to fulfill this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Usually the best approach is to create a Junction Option as described in option B. Providing the flexebility as requested.

B. Add an Order_Shipment_Group__c custom object and create master-detail relationships to both Order__c and Order_Line__c.

This approach allows you to associate multiple Order_Line__c records with different shipping locations to a single Order__c record through the Order_Shipment_Group__c object. It provides the flexibility needed to manage split shipments for orders.

Selected Answer: C
Order_Shipment_Group__c object and master-detail field on Order_Line__c

choices.D: Order_Shipment_Group__c object and master-detail field on Order_Shipment_Group__c
choices.C: Order_Shipment_Group__c object and master-detail field on Order_Line__c
choices.B: Order_Shipment_Group__c object and master-detail fields to Order__c and Order_Line__c
choices.A: Order_Shipment_Group__c object and master-detail field on Order__c

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants Opportunities to no longer be editable when reaching the Closed/Won stage.

Which two strategies can a developer use to accomplish this? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
BD ARE correct the new version of this question does not have as a option c & a -> Universal Containers wants Opportunities to no longer be editable when it reaches the Closed/Won
 stage.
 Which two strategies can a developer use to accomplish this?
 A. Use a validation rule.
 B. Use a before-save Apex trigger.
 C. Use an automatically launched Approval Process.
 D. Use an auto-response rule.

Selected Answer: BD
Is B & D

Selected Answer: BC
I think you can setup Approval process to lock the record.

comments.content: But if "Process Automation Settings" means the setup page, then B & D
